short_text: The Surah derives its name from the very first word wan Najm. This title also does not relate to the subject matter, but is a name given to the Surah as a symbol.
text:
The Surah derives its name from the very first word wan Najm. This title also does not relate to the subject matter, but is a name given to the Surah as a symbol.

Period of Revelation

According to a Tradition related by Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Da'ud and Nasai, on the authority of Hadrat Abdullah bin Mas'ud, the first Surah in which a verse requiring the performance of a sajdah (prostration) as sent down, is Surah An-Najm. The parts of this Hadith which have been reported by Aswad bin Yazid, Abu Ishaq and Zubair bin Mu'awiyah from Hadrat Ibn Mas'ud, indicate that this is the first Surah of the Qur'an, which the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had publicly recited before an assembly of the Quraish (and according to Ibn Marduyah, in the Ka'bah) in which both the believers and the disbelievers were present. At the end, when he recited the verse requiring the performance of a sajdah and fell down in prostration, the whole assembly also fall down in prostration with him, and even those chiefs of the polytheists who were in the forefront of the opposition to the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)
could not resist falling down in prostration. Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) says that he saw only one man, Umayyah bin Khalaf, from among the disbelievers, who did not fall down in prostration but took a little dust and rubbing it on his forehead said that that was enough for him. Later, as Ibn Mas'ud relates, he saw this man die in the state of disbelief.

Another eye witness of this incident is Hadrat Muttalib bin Abi Wada'ah, who had not yet become a Muslim. Nasai and Musnad Ahmad contain his own words to the effect: "When the Holy Prophet recited the Surah An-Najm and performed the sajdah and the whole assembly fell down in prostration along with him, I did not perform the sajdah. Now to compensate for the same whenever I recite this Surah I make sure never to abandon its performance."

Ibn Sad says that before this, in the Rajab of the 5th year of Prophethood, a small group of the Companions had emigrated to Abyssinia. Then, when in the Ramadan of the same year this incident took place the news spread that the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had recited Surah An-Najm publicly in the assembly of the Quraish and the whole assembly, including the believers as well as the disbelievers, had fallen down in prostration with him. When the emigrants to Abyssinia heard this news they formed the impression that the disbelievers of Makkah had become Muslims. Thereupon, some of them returned to Makkah in the Shawwal of the 5th year of Prophethood, only to learn that the news was wrong and the conflict between Islam and disbelief was raging as furiously as before. Consequently, the second emigration to Abyssinia took place, in which many more people left Makkah.

Thus, it becomes almost certain that this Surah was revealed in the Ramadan of 5th year of Prophethood.

Historical Background

The details of the period of revelation as given above point to the conditions in which this Surah was revealed. During the first five years of his appointment as a Prophet, the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had been extending invitation to Allah's Religion by presenting the Divine Revelations before the people only in private and restricted meetings and assemblies. During this whole period he could never have a chance to recite the Quran before a common gathering openly, mainly because of the strong opposition and resistance from the disbelievers. They were well aware of how magnetic and captivating was the Holy Prophet's personality and his way of preaching and how impressive were the Revelations of the Qur'an. Therefore, they tried their best to avoid hearing it them- selves and to stop others also from hearing it and to suppress his invitation by false propaganda by spreading every kind of suspicion against him. For this object, on the one hand,
they were telling the people that Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had gone astray and was now bent upon misleading others as well; on the other hand, they would raise on uproar whenever he tried to present the Qur'an before the people so that no one could know what it was for which he was being branded as a misled and misguided person.

Such were the conditions when the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) suddenly stood up one day to make a speech in the sacred precincts of the Ka'bah, where a large number of the Quraish had gathered together. Allah at that time made him deliver this discourse, which we have now in the form of the Surah An-Najm with us. Such was the intensity of the impression that when the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) started reciting it the opponents were so completely overwhelmed that they could not think of raising any disorder, and when at the conclusion he fell down in prostration, they too fell down in prostration along with him. Later they felt great remorse at the weakness they had involuntarily shown. The people also started taunting them to the effect that whereas they had been forbidding others to listen to the Qur'an, that day not only had they themselves listened to it, with complete absorption but had even fallen down in prostration
along with Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). At last, they had to invent a story in order to get rid of the people's taunt and ridicule. They said "After he had recited afara'ait-ul Lata wal Uzza wa Manat ath-thalitha-al ukhra, we heard from Muhammad the words: tilk al-gharaniqa- tal-'ula, wa anna shafa'at-u-hunna latarja : 'They are exalted goddesses: indeed, their intercession may be expected.' From this we understood that Muhammad had returned to our faith." As a matter of fact, only a mad person could think that in the context of this Surah the sentences they claimed to have heard could have any place and relevance.(For details, please see E. N.'s 96 to 301 of Surah Al Hajj).

Subject Matter and Topics

The theme of the discourse is to warn the disbelievers of Makkah about the error of the attitude that they had adopted towards the Qur'an and the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).

The discourse starts in a way as if to say: "Muhammad is neither deluded nor gone astray, as you are telling others in your propaganda against him, nor has he fabricated this teaching of Islam and its message, as you seem to think he has. In fact, whatever he is presenting is nothing but Revelation which is sent down to him. The verities that be presents before you, are not the product of his own surmise and speculation but realities of which he himself is an eye witness. He has himself seen the Angel through whom this knowledge is conveyed to him. He has been directly made to observe the great Signs of his Lord: whatever he says is not what he has himself thought out but what he has seen with his own eyes. Therefore, your disputing and wrangling with him is just like the disputing and wrangling of a blind man with a man of sight over a thing which the blind man cannot see but he can see."

After this, three things have been presented in their successive order:

First, the listeners have been made to understand that: "The religion that you are following is based on mere conjecture and invented ideas. You have set up a few goddesses like Lat and Manat and Uzza as your deities, whereas they have no share whatever in divinity. You regard the angels as the daughters of Allah, whereas you regard a daughter as disgraceful for your own selves. You think that these deities of fours can influence Allah in your favor, whereas the fact is that all the angels together, who are stationed closest to Allah, cannot influence Him even in their own favor. None of such beliefs that you have adopted, is based on knowledge and reason, but are wishes and desires for the sake of which you have taken some whims as realities. This is a grave error. The right and true religion is that which is in conformity to the reality, and the reality is never subject to thee people's wishes and desires so that whatever they may regard as a reality and truth should become
the reality and truth. Speculation and conjecture cannot help to determine as to what is according to the truth and what is not; it is knowledge. When that knowledge is presented before you, you turn away from it, and brand the one who tells you the truth as misguided. The actual cause of your being involved in this error is that you are heedless of the Hereafter. Only this world is your goal. Therefore, you have neither any desire for the knowledge of reality, nor you bother to see 'whether the beliefs you hold are according to the truth or not.

Secondly, the people have been told that: Allah is the caster and Sovereign of the entire Universe. The righteous is he who follows His way, and the misguided he who has turned away from His way. The error of the misguided and the righteousness of the righteous are not hidden from Him. He knows whatever everyone is doing: He will requite the evil with evil and the good with good. The final judgment will not depend on what you consider yourself to be, and on tall claims you make of your purity and chastity but on whether you are pious or impious, righteous or unrighteous, in the sight of God. If you refrain from major sins, He in His mercy will overlook your minor errors.'' .

Thirdly, a few basic principles of the true Religion which had been presented hundreds of years before the revelation of the Qur'an in the Books of the Prophets Abraham and Moses have been reiterated so that the people did not remain involved in the misunderstanding that the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had brought some new and novel religion, but they should know that these are the fundamental truths which the former Prophets of Allah have always been presenting in their respective ages. Besides, the same Books have been quoted to confirm the historical facts that the destruction of the 'Ad and the Thamud and of the people of the Prophets Noah and Lot was not the result of accidental calamities, but Allah has destroyed them in consequence of the same wickedness and rebellion from which the disbelievers of Makkah were not inclined to refrain and desist in any case.

After presenting these themes and discourses the Surah has been concluded, thus: "The Hour of Judgment has approached near at hand, which no one can avert. Before the occurrence of that Hour you are being warned through Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the Quran in the like manner as the former people had been warned before. Now, is it this warning that you find novel and strange? Which you mock and ridicule? Which you turn away from and cause disorder so that no one else also is able to hear what it is ? Don't you feel like weeping at your folly and ignorance? Abandon this attitude and behavior, bow down to Allah and serve Him alone!"

This was that impressive conclusion hearing which even the most hardened deniers of the Truth were completely overwhelmed, and when after reciting these verses of Divine Word the Holy Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) fell down in prostration, they too could not help falling down in prostration along with him.
description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by every one of The Stars, as they descend and disappear beneath the horizon, that Muhammad is indeed God’s awaited Messenger. It takes its name from verse 1, which mentions “the stars” (najm). The surah confirms the divine source of the Prophet’s message and refers to his ascension to heaven during the Night Journey (verse 1 .). The surah refutes the claims of the disbelievers about the goddesses and the angels (verse 19 .), and lists several truths about God’s power. It closes with a warning of the imminent Day of Judgement.The surah is also known as: The Pleiades.

Efendi Nahi.verse 53:2: shoku juaj (Muhammedi) as nuk e ka humbë as nuk e ka shmangë rrugën e drejtë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:3: Ai nuk flet sipas qejfit të vet –
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:4: Ajo (që flet ai) është vetëm Shpallja, që i ka ardhur atij,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:5: e mësoi atë një (engjëll) me fuqi të madhe,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:6: me inteligjencë të lartë, e u paraqit (në formën e vet),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:7: duek qenë në sferat e larta (qiellore),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:8: pastaj u afrua, e u lëshua, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:9: afër (sa) dy harqe ose edhe më afër,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:10: e ia shpalli robit të Tij (Pejgamberit) atë që ia shpalli.
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:11: Zemra e tij nuk e përgënjeshtroi atë që e pa,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:12: vallë, a po polemizoni me te për atë që e ka parë?
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:13: Ai (Muhammedi), me të vërtetë, e ka parë atë (Xhebrailin) edhe një herë tjetër,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:16: kur Sidrën e mbuloi ajo që e mbulonte, (një mbulesë e madhe),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:17: shikimi i tij (Muhammedit) nuku shmang, as që e kaloi (kufirin e caktuar).
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:18: Ai, me të vërtetë, i pa argumentet më madhështore të Zotit të tij.
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:19: A e keni pa Latin dhe Uzzan (si janë)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:20: Dhe Menatin, të tretin, të mbramin (sipas shkallës)? –
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:21: Vallë, a për ju janë djemtë, e për Ate (Perëndinë) vajzat?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:23: Ata (idhujt) janë vetëm emra që ua keni ngjitur ju dhe të parët tuaj, e Perëndia nuk ju ka dërguar për ta – kurrfarë argumenti. Ata ndjekin vetëm dyshimin dhe atë që janë të prirur; e, me të vërtetë, atyre u ka ardhur prej Zotit të tyre udhëzimi në rrugën e drejtë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:24: Ose, a për njeriun janë (të gjitha) çka dëshiron,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:25: vetëm Perëndisë i përkasin (të gjitha), ajo dhe kjo botë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:26: E, sa engjëj ka në qiej – ndërmjetësimi i të cilëve nuk bën dobi asgjë, përveç pasi të japë leje Perëndia, për kë të dojë Ai dhe kush është i denjë për te.
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:27: Me të vërtetë, ata që nuk besojnë në jetën tjetër, i emërojnë engjëjt me emra femërorë (i konsiderojnë femra)
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:28: e, për këtë, ata nuk kanë kurrfarë dijenie, ndjekin vetëm hamendjen (supozimin), e hamendja nuk sjell dobi asgjë për të vërtetën.
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:29: Andaj, ti (o Muhammed) largohu prej atij që i ikën Kur’anit dhe që dëshiron vetëm jetën e kësaj bote, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:30: kjo është arritja e tyre në dijeni, me të vërtetë, Zoti yt i njeh më së miri ata që janë shmangur nga rruga e Tij, dhe Ai i di më së miri ata që ndjekin rrugën e drejtë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:31: Perëndisë i përkasin të gjitha (çka ka) në qiej dhe në Tokë – e, sipas asaj që kanë punuar, për t’i dënuar ata që bëjnë keq, e për t’i shpërblyer ata që bëjnë mirë me shpërblim shumë të mirë, të madh,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:32: ata që ruhen prej mëkateve të mëdha dhe veprave të këqia (imorale), pos mëkateve të vogla. Me të vërtetë, Zoti yt është i gjerë (i pakufishëm) në falje. Ai, më së miri di për ju, qysh se u ka krijur prej dheut dhe qysh se keni qenë embion në barkun e nënave tuaja; andaj, mos u lavdëroni me pafajshmërinë tuaj – Ai e njeh mirë atë që ruhet nga mëkatet.
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:33: A e ke parë ti atë që është shmangur (nga e vërteta),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:34: pak ka dhënë, e pastaj e pengoi tjetrën,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:35: a i di ai gjërat sekrete, dhe a i sheh ato?
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:36: Vallë, a nuk është i lajmëruar ai – për atë që gjendet në fletët e Musait (në Teurat)
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:37: dhe të Ibrahimit: - “i cili i plotësoi (obligimet) –
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:38: që askush nuk do t’i bartë mëkatet e personit tjetër,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:39: dhe që njeriu do të ketë vetëm atë që është marrë me te (punuar atë)
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:40: dhe që përpjekjet e tij do të shihen së shpejti, padyshim
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:41: (dhe se) do të shpërblehet me shpërblim të plotë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:42: dhe, se, te Zoti yt do të jetë kthimi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:43: Ai jep gazin dhe vajin (gëzimin dhe hidhërimin),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:45: Ai krijon çiftet, mashkull e femër,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:46: prej pikës së farës (spermës) kur të hedhet (injektohet),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:47: dhe, me të vërtetë, tek Ai është krijimi i dytë (rindjallja),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:48: dhe Ai jep pasuri dhe kënaqësi të mjaftueshme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:50: dhe Ai e ka shkatërruar popullin e lashtë të Adit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:51: dhe Themudin, dhe s’ka lënë askë prej tyre,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:52: e madje, para tyre – popullin e Nuhut, i cili ka qenë (edhe) më zullumqarë dhe i zhytur edhe më shumë (në të këqia),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:53: dhe Ai i përmbysi vendbanimet (e popullit të Lutit),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:54: dhe i mbuloi ata çka i mbuloi (goditje e madhe),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:55: e, në çfarë dhuntie të Zotit tënd dyshon ti (polemizon)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:56: Ky paralajmërues (pejgamber) është si ata të mëparshmit.
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:57: U afrua ajo që është afër (Dita e Kijametit),
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:58: nuk mund ta zbulojë (atë) askush, pos Perëndisë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:59: E, vallë prej këtyre fjalëve (Kur’anit) po çuditeni,
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:60: dhe po qeshni, e nuk po qani? –
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:61: e, adje, jeni edhe të pakujdesshëm!
Efendi Nahi.verse 53:62: Bëni sexhde për Perëndinë dhe adhuronie (Ate)!

null.verse 53:1: Batmaqda olan ulduza (Sürəyya ulduzuna) and olsun ki,
null.verse 53:2: Sizin yoldaşınız (Muhəmməd əleyhissəlam) nə haqq yoldan sapmış, nə də azmışdır!
null.verse 53:3: O, kefi istəyəni (havadan) danışmır.
null.verse 53:4: Bu, ancaq (Allah dərgahından) nazil olan bir vəhydir.
null.verse 53:5: Onu (Muhəmməd əleyhissəlama) çox qüvvətli olan (Cəbrail) öyrətdi.
null.verse 53:6: O qüvvət (ağıl və gözəllik) sahibi (Peyğəmbər əleyhissəlama öz həqiqi şəklində) göründü.
null.verse 53:7: O (Cəbrail) ən uca üfüqdə (günəşin çıxdığı yerdə) idi.
null.verse 53:8: Sonra (Cəbrail Muhəmməd əleyhissəlama) yaxınlaşdı və aşağı endi.
null.verse 53:9: (Onların arasındakı məsafə) iki yay uzunluğunda, bəlkə, ondan da yaxın oldu.
null.verse 53:10: Sonra (Cəbrail Allahın ?z) bəndəsinə (Mühəmmədə) vəhy buyurduğunu vəhy etdi.
null.verse 53:11: Qəlb (Peyğəmbərin qəlbi) gördüyünü yalan saymadı. (Muhəmməd əleyhissəlam gözü ilə gördüyünün Cəbrail olduğuna qəlbdən inandı).
null.verse 53:12: Siz onunla gördüyü barəsində mübahisəmi edirsiniz?
null.verse 53:13: And olsun ki, (Muhəmməd əleyhiissəlam Cəbraili öz həqiqi surətində) başqa bir dəfə də (me'rac vaxtı) görmüşdü;
null.verse 53:15: (Mələklər, şəhidlər və müttəqilər məskəni olan) Mə'va cənnəti onun yanındadır.
null.verse 53:16: O zaman Sidrəni nələr bürümüşdü, nələr!
null.verse 53:17: Göz nə (sağa-sola) yayındı, nə də uzağa getdi (hər şeyi olduğu kimi gördü).
null.verse 53:18: And olsun ki, (Peyğəmbər) öz Rəbbininən böyük qüdrət nişanələrindən (mö'cüzələrindən) bir qismini (Beytül-mə'muru, Sidrətül-müntəhanı, Cənnəti, Cəhənnəmi, Rəfrəfi, altı yüz qanadı olan Cəbrailin həqiqi surətini və i. a.) gördü.
null.verse 53:19: (Ey müşriklər!) Bir deyin görək (sizin ibadət etdiyiniz) Lat və Uzza nəyə qadirdilər?!
null.verse 53:20: Digər üçüncü (büt) olan Mənat da həmçinin?!
null.verse 53:21: Məgər oğlanlar sizin, (bəyənmədiyiniz) qızlar Onundurmu?! (Allahındırmı)?!
null.verse 53:22: Elə isə bu ədalətsiz bölgüdür!
null.verse 53:23: Onlar (bütlər) sizin atalarınızın (özlərindən uydurub) qoyduqları adlardan başqa heç bir şey deyildir! (Onların yalnız quru adı var, heç bir şeyə qadir deyillər). Allah onlara (ibadət edilməsinə) dair heç bir dəlil endirməmişdir. Onlar (müşriklər) yalnız zənnə və nəfslərindən gələn istəklərə uyarlar. Halbuki Rəbbindən onlara haqq yolu göstərən rəhbər (Qur'an və Peyğəmbər) gəlmişdir.
null.verse 53:24: Yoxsa insan istədiyi hər şeyə nail ola bilər?! (Xeyr, bu mümkün deyildir. Müşriklərin çox istəməsinə baxmayaraq, bütlər onlar üçün Allah dərgahında heç bir şəfaət edə bilməzlər).
null.verse 53:25: Axirətdə, dünya da ancaq Allahındır!
null.verse 53:26: Göylərdə neçə-neçə mələklər vardır ki, onların şəfaəti heç bir fayda verməz. Ancaq Allah ?z istədiyi və razı olduğu kimsəyə (mələyə, yaxud mö'minə) izin verdikdən sonra (onun şəfaəti fayda verər).
null.verse 53:27: Həqiqətən, axirətə inanmayanlar mələklərə (onların Allahın qızları olduğunu iddia edərək) qadın adları verirlər.
null.verse 53:28: Onlar buna dair heç bir şey bilmir, yalnız zənnə qapılırlar. Zənn isə əsla həqiqət ola bilməz!
null.verse 53:29: Artıq (ya Peyğəmbər!) Bizim Qur'anımızdan üz çevirib dünya həyatından başqa bir şey istəməyənlərdən üz döndər!
null.verse 53:30: Onların bildiyi elə bu qədərdir. Şübhəsiz ki, sənin Rəbbin haqq yoldan azanı da, doğru yolda olanı da ən gözəl tanıyandır!
null.verse 53:31: Göylərdə və yerdə nə varsa, (hamısı) Allahındır. O, pislik edənlərə əməllərinin cəzasını verəcək, yaxşılıq edənləri isə ən gözəl mükafatla mükafatlandıracaqdır!
null.verse 53:32: (O yaxşılıq edənlər ki) kiçik günahlar (xətalar) istisna olmaqla, böyük günahlardan və rəzil işlərdən (zinadan) çəkinərlər. Həqiqətən, sənin Rəbbin çox bağışlayandır. Sizi torpaqdan yaradan da, siz analarınızın bətnlərində rüşeym halında olanda da sizi ən gözəl tanıyan Odur. ?zünüzü təmizə çıxartmayın. O, Allahdan qorxub pis əməllərdən çəkinənin kim olduğunu ən gözəl biləndir!
null.verse 53:33: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) İndi gördünmü (imandan) dönəni,
null.verse 53:34: Bir az (pul, mal) verib (qalanına) xəsislik göstərəni?
null.verse 53:35: Məgər o, qeybi bilirmi ki, (öz dostunun əzabına yüklənə biləcəyini) görsün?! (Müşriklərdən Vəlid ibn Müğirə islama meyl göstərmişdi. Bunu eşidən digər bir müşrik onu babalarının dinindən üz döndərməkdə ittiham edərək möhkəm danlamış və demişdi ki, əgər Müğirə ona müəyyən məbləğ pul, mal versə və islamı atıb öz dininə qayıtsa, o, axirətdə Müğirənin əzabını öz üzərinə götürəcəkdir. Müğirə islamdan üz döndərmiş, lakin xəsislik göstərib həmin şəxsə və'd etdiyi məbləğin hamısını deyil, bir qismini vermişdi).
null.verse 53:36: Yoxsa ona Musanın səhifələrindən olanlar xəbər verilmədi?!
null.verse 53:37: Və (əhdə) çox vəfalı olan (Allahın qarşısındakı borcunu layiqincə ödəyən) İbrahimin (sühüfündəkilər bildirilmədi?!)
null.verse 53:38: (Tövratda və İbrahimin səhifələrində deyilənlər bunlardır: ) "Heç bir günahkar başqasının günahına yüklənməz!
null.verse 53:39: İnsana ancaq öz zəhməti (sə'yi, çalışması, əməli) qalar!
null.verse 53:40: Şübhəsiz ki, (qiyamət günü) onun zəhməti (sə'yi, əməli) görünəcəkdir!
null.verse 53:41: Sonra da ona (zəhmətinin, əməlinin) tam əvəzi veriləcəkdir!"
null.verse 53:42: Həqiqətən, axır dönüş sənin Rəbbinədir!
null.verse 53:43: Güldürən də, ağladan da Odur!
null.verse 53:44: ?ldürən də, dirildən də Odur!
null.verse 53:45: (İnsanlardan və heyvanlardan ibarət) iki cifti (hər bir cütü) erkək və dişi olaraq yaradan Odur -
null.verse 53:46: (Bir qərtə) nütfədən (o, ata belindən analığa) axıb tökülərkən.
null.verse 53:47: (?lüləri) yenidən diriltmək də Ona aiddir!
null.verse 53:48: (İstədiyini) dövlətli də edən, kasıb da edən Odur!
null.verse 53:49: Şi'ranın (Şi'ra ulduzunun) da Rəbbi Odur!
null.verse 53:50: Əvvəlki (ilkin) Adı (Ad qövmünü) O məhv etdi.
null.verse 53:51: Səmudu da həmçinin! Və (onlardan heç kəsi sağ) buraxmadı.
null.verse 53:52: Daha əvvəl Nuh qövmünü (məhv etdi), çünki onlar daha zalım, daha azğın kimsələr idi.
null.verse 53:53: (Lut qövmünün yurdu) Mö'təfikənin də altını üstünə O çevirdi (qaldırıb yerə vurdu).
null.verse 53:54: Onları nələr sardı, nələr! (Başlarına nə müsibətlər gəldi!)
null.verse 53:55: (Ey insan!) Sən öz Rəbbinin hansı ne'mətlərinə şəkk edirsən?!
null.verse 53:56: Bu (Muhəmməd əleyhissəlam) da əvvəlki peyğəmbərlər kimi (insanları Allahın əzabı ilə) qorxudan bir peyğəmbərdir!
null.verse 53:58: Onu Allahdan başqa heç kəs dəf edə bilməz! (Və ya: onun dəqiq vaxtını Allahdan başqa heç kəs bilməz!)
null.verse 53:59: İndi siz bu kəlama (Qur'ana) təəccübmü edirsiniz?
null.verse 53:60: Həm də gülürsünüz, heç ağlamırsınız!
null.verse 53:62: (Ey insanlar!) Gəlin Allaha səcdə edin, (Allaha) ibadət edin! (Ondan başqasına itaət etməyin!)

null.verse 53:2: vaš drug
null.verse 53:3: On ne govori po hiru svome -
null.verse 53:4: to je samo Objava koja mu se obznanjuje,
null.verse 53:5: uči ga Jedan ogromne snage,
null.verse 53:6: razboriti, koji se pojavio u liku svome
null.verse 53:7: na obzorju najvišem,
null.verse 53:8: zatim se približio, pa nadnio -
null.verse 53:9: blizu koliko dva luka ili bliže -
null.verse 53:10: i objavio robu Njegovu ono što je objavio,
null.verse 53:11: srce nije poreklo ono što je vidio,
null.verse 53:12: pa zašto se prepirete s njim o onom što je vidio?
null.verse 53:13: On Ga je i drugi put vidio,
null.verse 53:15: kod kojeg je džennetsko prebivalište,
null.verse 53:16: kad je Sidru pokrivalo ono što je pokrivalo -
null.verse 53:17: pogled mu nije skrenuo, nije prekoračio,
null.verse 53:18: vidio je najveličanstvenija znamenja svoga Gospodara.
null.verse 53:19: Šta kažete o Latu i Uzzau
null.verse 53:20: i Menatu, trećoj, najmanje cijenjenoj? -
null.verse 53:21: Zar su za vas sinovi, a za Njega kćeri?!
null.verse 53:22: To bi tada bila podjela nepravedna.
null.verse 53:23: To su samo imena koja ste im vi i preci vaši nadjenuli, Allah o njima nikakav dokaz nije poslao; oni se povode samo za pretpostavkama i onim za čim duše žude, a već im dolazi od Gospodara njihova prava uputa.
null.verse 53:24: Ne može čovjek ostvariti sve što poželi,
null.verse 53:25: Allahu pripada i ovaj i onaj svijet!
null.verse 53:26: A koliko na nebesima ima meleka čije posredovanje nikome neće biti od koristi, sve dok Allah to ne dozvoli onome kome On hoće i u korist onoga kojim je zadovoljan.
null.verse 53:27: Oni koji ne vjeruju u onaj svijet nazivaju meleke imenima ženskim,
null.verse 53:28: a o tome ništa ne znaju, slijede samo pretpostavke, a pretpostavka istini baš nimalo ne koristi.
null.verse 53:29: Zato se ti okani onoga koji Kur’an izbjegava i koji samo život na ovome svijetu želi -
null.verse 53:30: to je vrhunac njihova znanja - Gospodar tvoj dobro zna one koji su skrenuli s Njegova puta i On dobro zna one koji su na pravome putu.
null.verse 53:31: Allahovo je sve što je na nebesima i što je na Zemlji - da bi, prema onome kako su radili, kaznio one koji rade zlo, a najljepšom nagradom nagradio one koji čine dobro,
null.verse 53:32: one koji se klone velikih grijehova i naročito razvrata, a grijehove bezazlene On će oprostiti jer Gospodar tvoj, zaista, mnogo prašta - On dobro zna sve o vama, otkad vas je stvorio od zemlje i otkad ste bili zameci u utrobama majki va#
null.verse 53:33: Reci ti Meni o onome koji istinu izbjegava
null.verse 53:34: i malo udjeljuje, i posve prestane udjeljivati,
null.verse 53:35: zna li on ono što je skriveno, pa vidi?
null.verse 53:36: Zar on nije obaviješten o onome šta se nalazi u listovima Musaovim
null.verse 53:37: i Ibrahimovim - koji je obaveze potpuno ispunjavao -
null.verse 53:38: da nijedan grješnik tuđe grijehe neće nositi,
null.verse 53:39: i da je čovjekovo samo ono što sam uradi,
null.verse 53:40: i da će se trud njegov, sigurno, iskazati,
null.verse 53:41: i da će prema njemu u potpunosti nagrađen ili kažnjen biti,
null.verse 53:42: i da će se Gospodaru tvome ponovo vratiti,
null.verse 53:43: i da On na smijeh i na plač navodi,
null.verse 53:44: i da On usmrćuje i oživljava
null.verse 53:45: i da On par, muško i žensko, stvara
null.verse 53:46: od kapi sjemena kad se izbaci;
null.verse 53:47: i da će ih On ponovo oživiti,
null.verse 53:48: i da On daje bogatstvo i moć da stječu,
null.verse 53:49: i da je On Sirijusa
null.verse 53:50: i da je On drevni narod Ad uništio,
null.verse 53:51: i Semud, i da nikog nije poštedio,
null.verse 53:52: i još prije Nuhov narod, koji je najokrutniji i najobjesniji bio;
null.verse 53:53: i prevrnuta naselja On je prevrnuo,
null.verse 53:54: i snašlo ih je ono što ih je snašlo
null.verse 53:55: pa, u koju blagodat Gospodara svoga ti još sumnjaš?
null.verse 53:56: Ovaj Kur’an je opomena kao i prijašnje opomene:
null.verse 53:58: Allah će ga jedini otkriti!
null.verse 53:59: Pa zar se ovom govoru iščuđavate -
null.verse 53:60: i smijete se, a ne plačete -
null.verse 53:62: Bolje padajte licem na tle pred Allahom i klanjajte se!

null.verse 53:2: তোমাদের সংগী পথভ্রষ্ট হননি এবং বিপথগামীও হননি।
null.verse 53:3: এবং প্রবৃত্তির তাড়নায় কথা বলেন না।
null.verse 53:4: কোরআন ওহী, যা প্রত্যাদেশ হয়।
null.verse 53:5: তাঁকে শিক্ষা দান করে এক শক্তিশালী ফেরেশতা,
null.verse 53:6: সহজাত শক্তিসম্পন্ন, সে নিজ আকৃতিতে প্রকাশ পেল।
null.verse 53:7: উর্ধ্ব দিগন্তে,
null.verse 53:8: অতঃপর নিকটবর্তী হল ও ঝুলে গেল।
null.verse 53:9: তখন দুই ধনুকের ব্যবধান ছিল অথবা আরও কম।
null.verse 53:10: তখন আল্লাহ তাঁর দাসের প্রতি যা প্রত্যাদেশ করবার, তা প্রত্যাদেশ করলেন।
null.verse 53:11: রসূলের অন্তর মিথ্যা বলেনি যা সে দেখেছে।
null.verse 53:12: তোমরা কি বিষয়ে বিতর্ক করবে যা সে দেখেছে?
null.verse 53:13: নিশ্চয় সে তাকে আরেকবার দেখেছিল,
null.verse 53:15: যার কাছে অবস্থিত বসবাসের জান্নাত।
null.verse 53:16: যখন বৃক্ষটি দ্বারা আচ্ছন্ন হওয়ার, তদ্দ্বারা আচ্ছন্ন ছিল।
null.verse 53:17: তাঁর দৃষ্টিবিভ্রম হয় নি এবং সীমালংঘনও করেনি।
null.verse 53:18: নিশ্চয় সে তার পালনকর্তার মহান নিদর্শনাবলী অবলোকন করেছে।
null.verse 53:19: তোমরা কি ভেবে দেখেছ লাত ও ওযযা সম্পর্কে।
null.verse 53:20: এবং তৃতীয় আরেকটি মানাত সম্পর্কে?
null.verse 53:21: পুত্র-সন্তান কি তোমাদের জন্যে এবং কন্যা-সন্তান আল্লাহর জন্য?
null.verse 53:22: এমতাবস্থায় এটা তো হবে খুবই অসংগত বন্টন।
null.verse 53:23: এগুলো কতগুলো নাম বৈ নয়, যা তোমরা এবং তোমাদের পূর্ব-পুরুষদের রেখেছ। এর সমর্থনে আল্লাহ কোন দলীল নাযিল করেননি। তারা অনুমান এবং প্রবৃত্তিরই অনুসরণ করে। অথচ তাদের কাছে তাদের পালনকর্তার পক্ষ থেকে পথ নির্দেশ এসেছে।
null.verse 53:24: মানুষ যা চায়, তাই কি পায়?
null.verse 53:25: অতএব, পরবর্তী ও পূর্ববর্তী সব মঙ্গলই আল্লাহর হাতে।
null.verse 53:26: আকাশে অনেক ফেরেশতা রয়েছে। তাদের কোন সুপারিশ ফলপ্রসূ হয় না যতক্ষণ আল্লাহ যার জন্যে ইচ্ছা ও যাকে পছন্দ করেন, অনুমতি না দেন।
null.verse 53:27: যারা পরকালে বিশ্বাস করে না, তারাই ফেরেশতাকে নারীবাচক নাম দিয়ে থাকে।
null.verse 53:28: অথচ এ বিষয়ে তাদের কোন জ্ঞান নেই। তারা কেবল অনুমানের উপর চলে। অথচ সত্যের ব্যাপারে অনুমান মোটেই ফলপ্রসূ নয়।
null.verse 53:29: অতএব যে আমার স্মরণে বিমুখ এবং কেবল পার্থিব জীবনই কামনা করে তার তরফ থেকে আপনি মুখ ফিরিয়ে নিন।
null.verse 53:30: তাদের জ্ঞানের পরিধি এ পর্যন্তই। নিশ্চয় আপনার পালনকর্তা ভাল জানেন, কে তাঁর পথ থেকে বিচ্যুত হয়েছে এবং তিনিই ভাল জানেন কে সুপথপ্রাপ্ত হয়েছে।
null.verse 53:31: নভোমন্ডল ও ভূমন্ডলে যা কিছু আছে, সবই আল্লাহর, যাতে তিনি মন্দকর্মীদেরকে তাদের কর্মের প্রতিফল দেন এবং সৎকর্মীদেরকে দেন ভাল ফল।
null.verse 53:32: যারা বড় বড় গোনাহ ও অশ্লীলকার্য থেকে বেঁচে থাকে ছোটখাট অপরাধ করলেও নিশ্চয় আপনার পালনকর্তার ক্ষমা সুদূর বিস্তৃত। তিনি তোমাদের সম্পর্কে ভাল জানেন, যখন তিনি তোমাদেরকে সৃষ্টি করেছেন মৃত্তিকা থেকে এবং যখন তোমরা মাতৃগর্ভে কচি শিশু ছিলে। অতএব তোমরা আত্নপ্রশংসা করো না। তিনি ভাল জানেন কে সংযমী।
null.verse 53:33: আপনি কি তাকে দেখেছেন, যে মুখ ফিরিয়ে নেয়।
null.verse 53:34: এবং দেয় সামান্যই ও পাষাণ হয়ে যায়।
null.verse 53:35: তার কাছে কি অদৃশ্যের জ্ঞান আছে যে, সে দেখে?
null.verse 53:36: তাকে কি জানানো হয়নি যা আছে মূসার কিতাবে,
null.verse 53:37: এবং ইব্রাহীমের কিতাবে, যে তার দায়িত্ব পালন করেছিল?
null.verse 53:38: কিতাবে এই আছে যে, কোন ব্যক্তি কারও গোনাহ নিজে বহন করবে না।
null.verse 53:39: এবং মানুষ তাই পায়, যা সে করে,
null.verse 53:40: তার কর্ম শীঘ্রই দেখা হবে।
null.verse 53:41: অতঃপর তাকে পূর্ণ প্রতিদান দেয়া হবে।
null.verse 53:42: তোমার পালনকর্তার কাছে সবকিছুর সমাপ্তি,
null.verse 53:43: এবং তিনিই হাসান ও কাঁদান
null.verse 53:44: এবং তিনিই মারেন ও বাঁচান,
null.verse 53:45: এবং তিনিই সৃষ্টি করেন যুগল-পুরুষ ও নারী।
null.verse 53:46: একবিন্দু বীর্য থেকে যখন স্খলিত করা হয়।
null.verse 53:47: পুনরুত্থানের দায়িত্ব তাঁরই,
null.verse 53:48: এবং তিনিই ধনবান করেন ও সম্পদ দান করেন।
null.verse 53:49: তিনি শিরা নক্ষত্রের মালিক।
null.verse 53:50: তিনিই প্রথম আদ সম্প্রদায়কে ধ্বংস করেছেন,
null.verse 53:51: এবং সামুদকেও; অতঃপর কাউকে অব্যহতি দেননি।
null.verse 53:52: এবং তাদের পূর্বে নূহের সম্প্রদায়কে, তারা ছিল আরও জালেম ও অবাধ্য।
null.verse 53:53: তিনিই জনপদকে শুন্যে উত্তোলন করে নিক্ষেপ করেছেন।
null.verse 53:54: অতঃপর তাকে আচ্ছন্ন করে নেয় যা আচ্ছন্ন করার।
null.verse 53:55: অতঃপর তুমি তোমার পালনকর্তার কোন অনুগ্রহকে মিথ্যা বলবে?
null.verse 53:56: অতীতের সতর্ককারীদের মধ্যে সে-ও একজন সতর্ককারী।
null.verse 53:58: আল্লাহ ব্যতীত কেউ একে প্রকাশ করতে সক্ষম নয়।
null.verse 53:59: তোমরা কি এই বিষয়ে আশ্চর্যবোধ করছ?
null.verse 53:60: এবং হাসছ-ক্রন্দন করছ না?
null.verse 53:62: অতএব আল্লাহকে সেজদা কর এবং তাঁর এবাদত কর। [ Sajdah ]

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:1: Кълна се в звездата, когато залязва,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:2: не се е заблудил вашият спътник [Мухаммад] и не се е отклонил,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:3: и не говори той от себе си.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:4: Това е само откровение, което [му] се разкрива.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:6: който има мощ. Той се възправи,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:8: после се приближи и се спусна,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:9: и бе на разстояние два лъка или по-близо.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:10: Тогава [Аллах посредством Джибрил] разкри на Своя раб [Мухаммад], каквото разкри.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:11: Сърцето му не го излъга за онова, което видя.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:12: Нима ще го оспорвате за онова, което видя?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:13: И отново го видя при друго спускане
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:14: до лотосовото дърво на крайния предел,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:16: Когато дървото бе покрито с онова, което го покрива...
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:17: И не се отклони погледът [на Мухаммад], и не се откъсна.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:18: Той видя някои от най-големите знамения на своя Господ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:19: А нима не виждате какво са ал-Лат и ал-Узза,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:21: Нима за вас е мъжкото, а пък за Него - женското?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:23: Те са само имена, които назовахте вие и предците ви. Аллах не им низпосла довод. [Неверниците] следват само догадката и онова, което душите обичат, въпреки че при тях дойде напътствието от техния Господ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:24: Или човек притежава всичко, което пожелае?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:25: На Аллах принадлежи и отвъдното, и настоящето.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:26: И колко ангели има на небесата, чието застъпничество не избавя от нищо, освен след като Аллах позволи комуто пожелае, и благоволи.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:27: Онези, които не вярват в отвъдното, назовават ангелите с женски имена,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:28: без да имат знание за това. Те следват само догадката. Ала догадката с нищо не заменя истината.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:29: И се отдръпни от онзи, който се отвръща от Нашето напомняне, и пожелава само земния живот!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:30: Толкова са достигнали те от знанието. Твоят Господ най-добре знае кой се е отклонил от Неговия път и знае кой е напътеният.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:31: На Аллах е всичко на небесата и всичко на земята, за да въздаде на злосторниците за деянията им и за да въздаде на благодетелните с Най-прекрасното -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:32: на онези, които се предпазват от големите грехове и скверностите, освен малките провинения. Твоят Господ е Щедрия в опрощението. Най-добре Той ви знае, и когато ви сътвори от земята, и когато бяхте зародиши в майчините си утроби. Тъй че не самохвалствайте
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:33: Виждаш ли онзи, който се отвръща
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:34: и дава малко, и му се свиди?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:35: Нима той има знание за неведомото и го вижда?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:36: Или не бе известен за онова, което е в свитъците на Муса
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:38: че никой прегрешил не ще носи греха на друг
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:39: и човек ще има само онова, за което се е постарал,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:40: и старанието му ще бъде видяно,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:41: после напълно ще му се въздаде,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:42: и че при твоя Господ е завършекът,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:43: и Той поражда смеха и плача,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:45: и Той създава двойките - мъжко и женско, -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:46: от капка сперма, когато се изхвърля [в утробата],
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:47: и от Него е повторното сътворяване,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:48: и Той дарява богатство и удовлетворение,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:49: и Той е Господът на Сириус,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:51: и самудяните, и не остави никого от тях,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:52: и също - народа на Нух преди, те бяха още по-угнетяващи и престъпващи,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:53: и Той опустоши сринатите [селища на Лут],
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:54: и ги покри, каквото ги покри.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:55: Тогава в кои благодеяния на твоя Господ се съмняваш [о, човече]?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:56: И този [Мухаммад] е предупредител, подобен на първите предупредители.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:58: Никой освен Аллах не ще го разкрие.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:59: Нима на тази вест се чудите
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:60: и се смеете, а не плачете,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 53:62: Сведете чела до земята в суджуд пред Аллах и на Него служете!

null.verse 53:2: 你們的朋友，既不迷誤，又未迷信，
null.verse 53:3: 也未隨私欲而言。
null.verse 53:4: 這只是他所受的啟示，
null.verse 53:5: 教授他的，是那強健的、
null.verse 53:6: 有力的，故他達到全美。
null.verse 53:7: 他在東方的最高處，
null.verse 53:8: 然後他漸漸接近而降低，
null.verse 53:9: 他相距兩張弓的長度，或更近一些。
null.verse 53:10: 他把他所應啟示的啟示他的僕人，
null.verse 53:11: 他的心沒有否認他所見的。
null.verse 53:12: 道你們要為他所見的而與他爭論嗎？
null.verse 53:13: 他確已見他二次下降，
null.verse 53:15: 那裡有歸宿的樂園。
null.verse 53:16: 當酸棗樹蒙上一層東西的時候，
null.verse 53:17: 眼未邪視，也未過分；
null.verse 53:18: 他確已看見他的主的一部分最大的跡象。
null.verse 53:19: 他們告訴我吧！拉特和歐薩，
null.verse 53:20: 以及排行第三，也是最次的默那，怎麼是真主的女兒呢？
null.verse 53:21: 難道男孩歸你們，女孩卻歸真主嗎？
null.verse 53:22: 然而，這是不公平的分配。
null.verse 53:23: 這些偶像只是你們和你們的祖先所定的名稱，真主並未加以証實，他們只是憑猜想和私欲。正道確已從他們的主降臨他們。
null.verse 53:24: 難道人希望什麼就有什麼？
null.verse 53:25: 後世和今世，都是真主的。
null.verse 53:26: 天上的許多天神，他們的說情，毫無裨益，除非在真主許可他們為他所意欲和所喜悅者說情之後，
null.verse 53:27: 不信後世的人們，的確以女性的名稱稱呼天神們。
null.verse 53:28: 他們對於那種稱呼，絕無任何知識，他們只憑猜想；而猜想對於真理，確是毫無裨益的。
null.verse 53:29: 你應當避開那違背我的教誨，且只欲享今世生活者；
null.verse 53:30: 那是他們的知識程度。你的主，確是全知背離正道者的，也是全知遵循正道者的。
null.verse 53:31: 天地萬物，都是真主的。他創造萬物，以便他依作惡者的行為而報酬他們，並以至善的品級報酬行善者。
null.verse 53:32: 遠離大罪和醜事，但犯小罪者，你的主確是寬宥的。當他從大地創造你們的時候，當你們是在母腹中的胎兒的時候，他是全知你們的；所以你們不要自稱清白，他是全知敬畏者的。
null.verse 53:33: 你告訴我吧！違背正道，
null.verse 53:34: 稍稍施捨就慳吝的人，
null.verse 53:35: 難道他知道幽玄，故認自己的行為為真理嗎？
null.verse 53:36: 難道沒有人告訴過他穆薩的經典，
null.verse 53:37: 和履行誡命的易卜拉欣的經典中所記載的事情嗎？
null.verse 53:38: 一個負罪者，不負別人的罪。
null.verse 53:39: 各人只得享受自己的勞績；
null.verse 53:40: 他的勞績，將被看見，
null.verse 53:41: 然後他將受最完全的報酬。
null.verse 53:42: 你的主，是眾生的歸宿。
null.verse 53:43: 他能使人笑，能使人哭；
null.verse 53:44: 他能使人死，能使人生；
null.verse 53:45: 他曾創造配偶──男性的與女性的──
null.verse 53:46: 是以射出的精液；
null.verse 53:47: 他以再造為自己的責任；
null.verse 53:48: 他能使人富足，能使人滿意；
null.verse 53:49: 他是天狼星的主。
null.verse 53:50: 他毀滅了古時的阿德人，
null.verse 53:51: 和賽莫德人，而未曾有所遺留；
null.verse 53:52: 以前，他毀滅了努哈的宗族。他們確是更不義的，確是更放蕩的。
null.verse 53:53: 他使那被顛覆的城市覆亡，
null.verse 53:54: 故覆蓋的東西曾覆蓋了那城市。
null.verse 53:55: 你懷疑你的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 53:56: 這是古時的那些警告者之中的一個警告者。
null.verse 53:57: 臨近的事件，已經臨近了；
null.verse 53:58: 除真主外，沒有能揭示它的。
null.verse 53:59: 難道你們為這訓辭而詫異嗎？
null.verse 53:60: 你們怎麼嘲笑而不痛哭呢？
null.verse 53:62: 你們應當為真主而叩頭，應當崇拜他。

null.verse 53:2: Váš druh nebloudí, ani nebyl sveden,
null.verse 53:3: ani nehovoří z vlastního popudu svého.
null.verse 53:4: Je to vnuknutí pouze, jež bylo mu vnuknuto,
null.verse 53:5: jemuž naučil jej silný mocí,
null.verse 53:6: silou vládnoucí; a vzpřímeně se tyčil,
null.verse 53:7: zatímco na nejvyšším obzoru byl.
null.verse 53:8: Potom se přiblížil a dolů se spustil,
null.verse 53:9: až na vzdálenost dvou luků či ještě blíže byl,
null.verse 53:10: a vnukl svému služebníkovi to, co mu vnukl.
null.verse 53:11: A srdce jeho mu v tom, co viděl, nelhalo.
null.verse 53:12: Chcete snad pochybnost vyslovit o tom, co zřel?
null.verse 53:13: A věru jej viděl již u příležitosti sestoupení jiného
null.verse 53:14: poblíže lotosového stromu u okraje nejzazšího,
null.verse 53:15: u něhož je zahrada příbytku věčného.
null.verse 53:16: A když přikrylo lotosový strom to, co jej krylo,
null.verse 53:17: oko se neodvrátilo ani nebloudilo,
null.verse 53:18: a věru spatřil on největší ze znamení Pána svého!
null.verse 53:19: Uvažovali jste o al-Lát a al-´Uzzá
null.verse 53:20: a Manát, té třetí, jiné?
null.verse 53:21: Vy syny byste měli mít a On pouze dcery?
null.verse 53:22: To vskutku rozdělení by bylo nerovné!
null.verse 53:23: Ony nejsou nic než jména, kterými jste je vy a vaši otcové nazvali a o nichž neseslal Bůh žádné zplnomocnění. A oni pouze své dohady a to, k čemu srdce jejich tíhnou, následují, ačkoliv se jim již od Pána jejich dostalo správného vedení.
null.verse 53:24: Což člověk má mít vše, po čem touží?
null.verse 53:25: Však Bohu poslední i první život patří.
null.verse 53:26: A vůbec nic nepomůže přímluva andělů, ať sebevíc jich je na nebi, leda tehdy, když k tomu Bůh svolí, a pro toho, koho chtít bude a jehož si oblíbí.
null.verse 53:27: A vskutku ti, kdož nevěří v život budoucí, anděly ženskými jmény nazývají,
null.verse 53:28: byť o tom žádné vědění nemají a jen dohady své následují. Však dohady nic proti skutečnosti nezmohou!
null.verse 53:29: Odvrať se tedy od těch, kdo zády k Našemu připomenutí se obracejí a pouze k tomuto pozemskému životu tíhnou.
null.verse 53:30: Takový je rozsah jejich vědění! A Pán tvůj ví dobře o tom, kdo z cesty Jeho zbloudil, a zná nejlépe i toho, kdo po ní kráčí.
null.verse 53:31: Bohu náleží vše na nebesích a na zemi, aby mohl odměnit ty, kdož špatné páchali, a aby odměnil ty, kdož dobré konali, odměnou nejkrásnější,
null.verse 53:32: ty, kdož těžkých hříchů a nepravostí se varovali a jen drobných prohřešků se dopouštěli. A Pán tvůj věru rozsáhlým odpuštěním vládne a znal vás dobře už tehdy, když vytvořil vás ze země a když jste byli zárodky v lůnech matek svých. Nepovažujte tedy sebe za očištěné! A On nejlépe zná ty, kdo jsou bohabojní.
null.verse 53:33: Co soudíš o tom, jenž zády se obrací
null.verse 53:34: a málo jen rozdává a lakotí?
null.verse 53:35: Má snad vědomost o nepoznatelném, takže je vidí?
null.verse 53:36: Či nebylo mu sděleno, co obsahují svitky Mojžíše
null.verse 53:37: a Abrahama, jenž byl věrný?
null.verse 53:38: Že totiž žádná duše obtížená břímě jiné duše neponese,
null.verse 53:39: že člověku se jen toho, oč usiloval, dostane,
null.verse 53:40: že výsledek jeho úsilí bude viděn
null.verse 53:41: a potom plnou odměnou bude odměněn,
null.verse 53:42: že u Pána tvého je konečný cíl jen,
null.verse 53:43: že On rozesmává i rozplakává,
null.verse 53:44: že On smrt i život dává,
null.verse 53:45: že On stvořil pohlaví mužské a ženské
null.verse 53:46: z kapky semene vystříknuté,
null.verse 53:47: že Jemu přísluší stvoření druhé,
null.verse 53:48: že On obohacuje a uspokojuje,
null.verse 53:49: že On je ten, kdo Siria pánem je,
null.verse 53:50: že On dávným ´Ádovcům zahynout dal
null.verse 53:51: i Thamúdovcům, a žádného nenechal,
null.verse 53:52: a před nimi lidu Noemovu, neb to lid velmi nespravedlivý a vzpurný byl,
null.verse 53:53: a také Vyvrácené město zahubil,
null.verse 53:54: a pokrylo je to, co je pokrylo.
null.verse 53:55: A které z dobrodiní Pána svého chceš popírat?
null.verse 53:56: A toto je varování podobné varováním dřívějších.
null.verse 53:58: a není kromě Boha nikoho, kdo by ji vyjevil.
null.verse 53:59: Tento příběh vás snad údivem naplnil,
null.verse 53:60: že místo abyste plakali, se smějete
null.verse 53:62: Před Bohem na zem padejte a Jeho uctívejte!

null.verse 53:1: Bij de ster wanneer zij valt,
null.verse 53:2: Uw metgezel is noch afgedwaald noch afgeweken,
null.verse 53:3: Noch spreekt hij naar eigen begeerte.
null.verse 53:4: Het is slechts de Openbaring die wordt nedergezonden.
null.verse 53:5: Hij, die grote macht heeft, onderwees hem,
null.verse 53:6: Die kracht bezit. Zo is hij volmaakt geworden
null.verse 53:7: En hij staat aan de hoogste horizon.
null.verse 53:8: Hij naderde en kwam steeds nader.
null.verse 53:9: En werd als de spanning van twee bogen, Ja, nog dichter bij,
null.verse 53:10: En Hij (God) openbaarde aan Zijn dienaar hetgeen Hij wilde openbaren.
null.verse 53:11: Het hart loog niet over wat het zag.
null.verse 53:12: Wilt gij dan met hem redetwisten over hetgeen hij heeft gezien?
null.verse 53:13: En voorzeker, hij zag hem ook bij een andere nederdaling.
null.verse 53:14: Bij de Lotusboom waar niemand voorbij mag gaan,
null.verse 53:15: Waarnaast de Tuin van Verblijf is.
null.verse 53:16: Toen het goddelijke Licht de Lotusboom overstraalde
null.verse 53:17: Wendde zijn oog zich niet af, noch ging het de grens te buiten.
null.verse 53:18: Voorwaar, hij zag de grote tekenen van zijn Heer.
null.verse 53:19: Ziet, de Laat en de Ozza,
null.verse 53:20: En een ander, de derde, Manaat?
null.verse 53:21: "Zijn voor u de mannelijke wezens en voor Hem de vrouwelijke?"
null.verse 53:22: Dat is dan een onrechtvaardige verdeling;
null.verse 53:23: Dit zijn slechts namen die gij uitgedacht hebt - gij en uw vaderen - waarvoor God geen gezag heeft nedergezonden. Zij volgen slechts hun vermoedens en begeerten. En voorzeker de leiding van hun Heer is nu tot hen gekomen.
null.verse 53:24: Krijgt de mens alles waarnaar hij verlangt?
null.verse 53:25: Neen, aan God behoren het Hiernamaals en deze wereld.
null.verse 53:26: En hoevele engelen zijn er niet in de hemelen wier voorspraak van geen nut zal zijn, behalve nadat God verlof heeft gegeven aan wie Hij wil en wie Hem behaagt.
null.verse 53:27: Zij, die niet in het Hiernamaals geloven geven de engelen vrouwelijke namen,
null.verse 53:28: Maar zij hebben daar geen kennis van. Zij volgen alleen een vermoeden en het vermoeden kan tegen de waarheid niets baten.
null.verse 53:29: Wend u daarom van hem af die zich van de gedachtenis aan Ons afwendt, en die niets wenst dan het leven dezer wereld.
null.verse 53:30: Zo ver reikt hun kennis. Voorwaar, uw Heer kent het beste degene die van Zijn pad afdwaalt en Hij kent het beste degene die Zijn leiding volgt.
null.verse 53:31: En aan God behoort hetgeen in de hemelen en hetgeen op aarde is, opdat Hij degenen die slecht deden moge vergelden voor hetgeen zij hebben gewrocht en opdat Hji degenen die goed doen, met het beste moge belonen.
null.verse 53:32: Zij, die behalve kleine feilen, de ergste zonden en slechtheden vermijden - voorwaar, uw Heer is de Heer der Alomvattende Vergiffenis. Hij kende u toen H. u uit aarde deed ontstaan en toen gij een embryo waart in de baarmoeder uwer moeder. Prijst daarom uzelf niet om reinheid. Hij kent de godvruchtigen het beste.
null.verse 53:33: Ziet gij hem die zich afwendt (van het rechte pad)
null.verse 53:34: En die weinig geeft en vrekkig is?
null.verse 53:35: Bezit hij de kennis van het onzichtbare, zodat hij kan zien?
null.verse 53:36: Is hem niet verteld over hetgeen in de geschriften van Mozes staat,
null.verse 53:37: En van Abraham, die de geboden hield?
null.verse 53:38: Dat geen drager van last de last van een ander zal dragen;
null.verse 53:39: En dat de mens niet meer kan krijgen dan hetgeen waarnaar hij streeft.
null.verse 53:40: En dat zijn streven spoedig zal worden opgemerkt;
null.verse 53:41: Dan zal hij er volledig voor worden beloond.
null.verse 53:42: En dat alles uiteindelijk tot uw Heer komt,
null.verse 53:43: En dat Hij het is, Die doet lachen en wenen
null.verse 53:44: En dat Hij het is, Die de dood veroorzaakt en het leven geeft.
null.verse 53:45: En dat Hij de twee echtgenoten schept, de vrouwelijke en de mannelijke
null.verse 53:46: Uit een levenskiem wanneer deze uitgegoten wordt:
null.verse 53:47: En dat de volgende opwekking (tot leven) op Hem rust:
null.verse 53:48: En dat Hij het is Die voldoening en rijkdom geeft
null.verse 53:49: En dat Hij de Heer van Sirius is.
null.verse 53:50: En dat Hij de oude (stam van Aad) vernietigde
null.verse 53:51: En Samoed, en Hij spaarde (hen) niet,
null.verse 53:52: Evenals het volk van Noach vóórdien; waarlijk zij waren uiterst onrechtvaardig en opstandig
null.verse 53:53: En Hij bracht de verwoeste steden ten val,
null.verse 53:54: Zodat hetgeen bedekken kon, hen bedekte.
null.verse 53:55: Over welke gaven van uw Heer wilt gij dan redetwisten?
null.verse 53:56: Deze waarschuwer is gelijk aan de vroegere waarschuwers.
null.verse 53:58: Niemand behalve God kan het ontsluieren.
null.verse 53:59: Verwondert gij u dan over deze aankondiging?
null.verse 53:60: En lacht gij in plaats van te wenen,
null.verse 53:62: Werpt u voor God neder en aanbidt (Hem).

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:1: By the Star when it setteth,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:2: Your comrade erreth not, nor is deceived;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:3: Nor doth he speak of (his own) desire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:4: It is naught save an inspiration that is inspired,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:5: Which one of mighty powers hath taught him,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:6: One vigorous; and he grew clear to view
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:7: When he was on the uppermost horizon.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:8: Then he drew nigh and came down
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:9: Till he was (distant) two bows’ length or even nearer,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:10: And He revealed unto His slave that which He revealed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:11: The heart lied not (in seeing) what it saw.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:12: Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he seeth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:13: And verily he saw him yet another time
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:14: By the lote-tree of the utmost boundary,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:15: Nigh unto which is the Garden of Abode.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:16: When that which shroudeth did enshroud the lote-tree,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:17: The eye turned not aside nor yet was overbold.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:18: Verily he saw one of the greater revelations of his Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:19: Have ye thought upon Al-Lat and Al-’Uzza
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:20: And Manat, the third, the other ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:21: Are yours the males and His the females ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:22: That indeed were an unfair division!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:23: They are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers, for which Allah hath revealed no warrant. They follow but a guess and that which (they) themselves desire. And now the guidance from their Lord hath come unto them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:24: Or shall man have what he coveteth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:25: But unto Allah belongeth the after (life), and the former.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:26: And how many angels are in the heavens whose intercession availeth naught save after Allah giveth leave to whom He chooseth and accepteth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:27: Lo! it is those who disbelieve in the Hereafter who name the angels with the names of females.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:28: And they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and lo! a guess can never take the place of the truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:29: Then withdraw (O Muhammad) from him who fleeth from Our remembrance and desireth but the life of the world.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:30: Such is their sum of knowledge. Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth, and He is Best Aware of him whom goeth right.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:31: And unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, that He may reward those who do evil with that which they have done, and reward those who do good with goodness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:32: Those who avoid enormities of sin and abominations, save the unwilled offences - (for them) lo! thy Lord is of vast mercy. He is Best Aware of you (from the time) when He created you from the earth, and when ye were hidden in the bellies of your mothers. Therefor ascribe not purity unto yourselves. He is Best Aware of him who wardeth off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:33: Didst thou (O Muhammad) observe him who turned away,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:34: And gave a little, then was grudging ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:35: Hath he knowledge of the Unseen so that he seeth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:36: Or hath he not had news of what is in the books of Moses
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:37: And Abraham who paid his debt:
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:38: That no laden one shall bear another’s load,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:39: And that man hath only that for which he maketh effort,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:40: And that his effort will be seen.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:41: And afterward he will be repaid for it with fullest payment;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:42: And that thy Lord, He is the goal;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:43: And that He it is who maketh laugh, and maketh weep,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:44: And that He it is Who giveth death and giveth life;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:45: And that He createth the two spouses, the male and the female,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:46: From a drop (of seed) when it is poured forth;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:47: And that He hath ordained the second bringing forth;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:48: And that He it is Who enricheth and contenteth;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:49: And that He it is Who is the Lord of Sirius;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:50: And that He destroyed the former (tribe of) A’ad,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:51: And (the tribe of) Thamud He spared not;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:52: And the folk of Noah aforetime, Lo! they were more unjust and more rebellious;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:54: So that there covered them that which did cover.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:55: Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord, canst thou dispute ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:56: This is a warner of the warners of old.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:58: None beside Allah can disclose it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:59: Marvel ye then at this statement,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 53:62: Rather prostrate yourselves before Allah and serve Him.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:1: By the Star when it goes down,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:2: Your Companion is neither astray nor being misled.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:3: Nor does he say (aught) of (his own) Desire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:4: It is no less than inspiration sent down to him:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:5: He was taught by one Mighty in Power,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:6: Endued with Wisdom: for he appeared (in stately form);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:7: While he was in the highest part of the horizon:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:8: Then he approached and came closer,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:9: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:10: So did (God) convey the inspiration to His Servant- (conveyed) what He (meant) to convey.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:11: The (Prophet’s) (mind and) heart in no way falsified that which he saw.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:12: Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he saw?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:13: For indeed he saw him at a second descent,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:14: Near the Lote-tree beyond which none may pass:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:15: Near it is the Garden of Abode.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:16: Behold, the Lote-tree was shrouded (in mystery unspeakable!)
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:17: (His) sight never swerved, nor did it go wrong!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:18: For truly did he see, of the Signs of his Lord, the Greatest!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:21: What! for you the male sex, and for Him, the female?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:22: Behold, such would be indeed a division most unfair!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:23: These are nothing but names which ye have devised,- ye and your fathers,- for which God has sent down no authority (whatever). They follow nothing but conjecture and what their own souls desire!- Even though there has already come to them Guidance from their Lord!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:24: Nay, shall man have (just) anything he hankers after?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:25: But it is to God that the End and the Beginning (of all things) belong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:26: How many-so-ever be the angels in the heavens, their intercession will avail nothing except after God has given leave for whom He pleases and that he is acceptable to Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:27: Those who believe not in the Hereafter, name the angels with female names.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:28: But they have no knowledge therein. They follow nothing but conjecture; and conjecture avails nothing against Truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:29: Therefore shun those who turn away from Our Message and desire nothing but the life of this world.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:30: That is as far as knowledge will reach them. Verily thy Lord knoweth best those who stray from His Path, and He knoweth best those who receive guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:31: Yea, to God belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: so that He rewards those who do evil, according to their deeds, and He rewards those who do good, with what is best.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:32: Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, only (falling into) small faults,- verily thy Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you well when He brings you out of the earth, And when ye are hidden in your mothers’ wombs. Therefore justify not yourselves: He knows best who it is that guards against evil.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:33: Seest thou one who turns back,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:34: Gives a little, then hardens (his heart)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:35: What! Has he knowledge of the Unseen so that he can see?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:36: Nay, is he not acquainted with what is in the Books of Moses-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:37: And of Abraham who fulfilled his engagements?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:38: Namely, that no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:39: That man can have nothing but what he strives for;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:40: That (the fruit of) his striving will soon come in sight:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:41: Then will he be rewarded with a reward complete;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:42: That to thy Lord is the final Goal;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:43: That it is He Who granteth Laughter and Tears;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:44: That it is He Who granteth Death and Life;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:45: That He did create in pairs,- male and female,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:46: From a seed when lodged (in its place);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:47: That He hath promised a Second Creation (Raising of the Dead);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:48: That it is He Who giveth wealth and satisfaction;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:49: That He is the Lord of Sirius (the Mighty Star);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:50: And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) ancient ’Ad (people),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:51: And the Thamud nor gave them a lease of perpetual life.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:52: And before them, the people of Noah, for that they were (all) most unjust and most insolent transgressors,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:53: And He destroyed the Overthrown Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:54: So that (ruins unknown) have covered them up.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:55: Then which of the gifts of thy Lord, (O man,) wilt thou dispute about?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:56: This is a Warner, of the (series of) Warners of old!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:58: No (soul) but God can lay it bare.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:59: Do ye then wonder at this recital?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:60: And will ye laugh and not weep,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 53:62: But fall ye down in prostration to God, and adore (Him)!

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:1: By the Star when it plunges,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:2: your comrade is not astray, neither errs,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:3: nor speaks he out of caprice.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:4: This is naught but a revelation revealed,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:5: taught him by one terrible in power,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:8: then drew near and suspended hung,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:9: two bows’ length away, or nearer,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:10: then revealed to his servant that he revealed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:11: His heart lies not of what he saw;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:12: what, will you dispute with him what he sees?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:13: Indeed, he saw him another time
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:14: by the Lote-Tree of the Boundary
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:15: nigh which is the Garden of the Refuge,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:16: when there covered the Lote-Tree that which covered;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:17: his eye swerved not; nor swept astray.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:18: Indeed, he saw one of the greatest signs of his Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:19: Have you considered El-Lat and El-’Uzza
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:20: and Manat the third, the other?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:21: What, have you males, and He females?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:22: That were indeed an unjust division.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:23: They are naught but names yourselves have named, and your fathers; God has sent down no authority touching them. They follow only surmise, and what the souls desire; and yet guidance has come to them from their Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:24: Or shall man have whatever he fancies?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:25: And to God belongs the First and the Last.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:26: How many an angel there is in the heavens whose intercession avails not anything, save after that God gives leave to whomsoever He wills and is well-pleased.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:27: Those who do not believe in the world to come name the angels with the names of females.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:28: They have not any knowledge thereof; they follow only surmise, and surmise avails naught against truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:29: So turn thou from him who turns away from Our Remembrance, and desires only the present life.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:30: That is their attainment of knowledge. Surely thy Lord knows very well those who have gone astray from His way, and He knows very well those who are guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:31: To God belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, that He may recompense those who do evil for what they have done, and recompense those who have done good with the reward most fair.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:32: Those who avoid the heinous sins and indecencies, save lesser offences surely thy Lord is wide in His forgiveness. Very well He knows you, when He produced you from the earth, and when you were yet unborn in your mothers’ wombs; therefore hold not yourselves purified; God knows very well him who is godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:33: Hast thou considered him who turns his back
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:34: and gives a little, and then grudgingly?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:35: Does he possess the knowledge of the Unseen, and therefore he sees?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:36: Or has he not been told of what is in the scrolls of Moses,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:37: and Abraham, he who paid his debt in full?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:38: That no soul laden bears the load of another,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:39: and that a man shall have to his account only as he has laboured,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:40: and that his labouring shall surely be seen,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:41: then he shall be recompensed for it with the fullest recompense,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:42: and that the final end is unto thy Lord,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:43: and that it is He who makes to laugh, and that makes to weep,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:44: and that it is He who makes to die, and that makes to live,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:45: and that He Himself created the two kinds, male and female,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:46: of a sperm-drop, when it was cast forth,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:47: and that upon Him rests the second growth,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:48: and that it is He who gives wealth and riches,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:49: and that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:50: and that He destroyed Ad, the ancient,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:51: and Thamood, and He did not spare them,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:52: and the people of Noah before -- certainly they did exceeding evil, and were insolent
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:53: and the Subverted City He also overthrew,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:54: so that there covered it that which covered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:55: Then which of thy Lord’s bounties disputest thou?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:56: This is a warner, of the warners of old.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:58: apart from God none can disclose it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:59: Do you then marvel at this discourse,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:60: and do you laugh, and do you not weep,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 53:62: So bow yourselves before God, and serve Him!

Muhammad Asad.verse 53:1: CONSIDER this unfolding [of God’s message], as it comes down from on high!
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:2: This fellow-man of yours has not gone astray, nor is he deluded,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:3: and neither does he speak out of his own desire:
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:4: that [which he conveys to you] is but [a divine] inspiration with which he is being inspired –
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:5: something that a very mighty one has imparted to him:
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:6: [an angel] endowed with surpassing power, who in time manifested himself in his true shape and nature,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:7: appearing in the horizon’s loftiest part,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:8: and then drew near, and came close,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:9: until he was but two bow-lengths away, or even nearer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:10: And thus did [God] reveal unto His servant whatever He deemed right to reveal.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:11: The [servant’s] heart did not give the lie to what he saw:
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:12: will you, then, contend with him as to what he saw?
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:13: And, indeed, he saw it descend a second time
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:14: by the lote-tree of the farthest limit,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:15: near unto the garden of promise,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:16: with the lote-tree veiled in a veil of nameless splendour....
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:17: [And withal,] the eye did not waver, nor yet did it stray:
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:18: truly did he see some of the most profound of his Sustainer’s symbols.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:19: HAVE YOU, then, ever considered [what you are worshipping in] Al-Lāt and Al-’Uzzā,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:20: as well as [in] Manāt, the third and last [of this triad]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:21: Why – for yourselves [you would choose only] male offspring, whereas to Him [you assign] female:
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:22: that, lo and behold, is an unfair division!
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:23: These [allegedly divine beings] are nothing but empty names which you have invented – you and your forefathers – [and] for which God has bestowed no warrant from on high. They [who worship them] follow nothing but surmise and their own wishful thinking – although right guidance has now indeed come unto them from their Sustainer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:24: Does man imagine that it is his due to have all that he might wish for,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:25: despite the fact that [both] the life to come and this present [one] belong to God ?
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:26: For, however many angels there be in the heavens, their intercession can be of no least avail [to anyone] – except after God has given leave [to intercede] for whomever He wills and with whom He is well-pleased.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:27: Behold, it is [only] such as do not [really] believe in the life to come that regard the angels as female beings;
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:28: and [since] they have no knowledge whatever thereof, they follow nothing but surmise: yet, behold, never can surmise take the place of truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:29: Avoid thou, therefore, those who turn away from all remembrance of Us and care for no more than the life of this world,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:30: which, to them, is the only thing worth knowing. Behold, thy Sustainer is fully aware as to who has strayed from His path, and fully aware is He as to who follows His guidance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:31: Indeed, unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth: and so He will reward those who do evil in accordance with what they did, and will reward those who do good with ultimate good.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:32: As for those who avoid the [truly] grave sins and shameful deeds – even though they may sometimes stumble – behold, thy Sustainer is abounding in forgiveness.He is fully aware of you when He brings you into being out of dust, and when you are still hidden in your mothers’ wombs: do not, then, consider yourselves pure – [for] He knows best as to who is conscious of Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:33: HAST THOU, then, ever considered him who turns away [from remembering Us, and cares for no more than the life of this world],
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:34: and gives so little [of himself for the good of his soul], and so grudgingly?
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:35: Does he [claim to] have knowledge of something that is beyond the reach of human perception, so that he can see [it clearly]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:36: Or has he never yet been told of what was [said] in the revelations of Moses,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:37: and of Abraham, who to his trust was true:
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:38: that no bearer of burdens shall be made to bear another’s burden;
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:39: and that nought shall be accounted unto man but what he is striving for;
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:40: and that in time [the nature of] all his striving will be shown [to him in its true light],
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:41: whereupon he shall be requited for it with the fullest requital;
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:42: and that with thy Sustainer is the beginning and the end [of all that exits];
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:43: and that it is He alone who causes [you] to laugh and to weep;
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:44: and that it is He alone who deals death and grants life;
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:45: and that it is He who creates the two kinds – the male and the female –
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:46: out of a [mere] drop of sperm as it is poured forth,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:47: and that [therefore] it is within His power to bring about a second life;
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:48: and that it is He alone who frees from want and causes to possess;
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:49: and that it is He alone who sustains the brightest star;
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:50: and that it is He who destroyed the ancient [tribes of] ’ād
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:51: and Thamūd, leaving no trace [of them],
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:52: as well as the people of Noah before them – [since,] verily, they all had been most willful in their evildoing and most overweening –
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:53: just as He thrust into perdition those cities that were overthrown
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:54: and then covered them from sight forever.
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:55: About which, then, of thy Sustainer’s powers canst thou [still] remain in doubt?
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:56: HIS IS a warning like those warnings of old:
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:57: that [Last Hour] which is so near draws ever nearer,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:58: [although] none but God can unveil it....
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:59: Do you, perchance, find this tiding strange?
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:60: And do you laugh instead of weeping,
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:61: and divert yourselves all the while?
Muhammad Asad.verse 53:62: [Nay,] but prostrate yourselves before God, and worship [Him alone]!

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:1: By the star when it goes down to set,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:2: your fellow (the Holy Prophet) has neither missed the way, nor did he deviate.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:3: He does not speak out of (his own) desire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:4: It is but revelation revealed (to him).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:5: It is taught to him by one (angel) of strong faculties,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:6: the one of vigour. So he stood poised,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:7: while he was on the upper horizon.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:8: Then he drew near, and came down,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:9: so as he was at a distance like that of two bows (joined together), rather even nearer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:10: Thus He (Allah) revealed to His slave what He revealed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:11: The heart did not err in what he saw.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:12: Do you quarrel with him in what he sees?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:13: Indeed he saw him another time
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:14: by Sidrat-ul-Muntahā (the lote-tree in the upper realm),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:15: near which there is Jannat-ul-Ma’wā (the Paradise of Abode),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:16: when the lote-tree was covered by that which covered it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:17: The eye neither went wrong, nor did exceed the limit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:18: He has indeed seen a part of the biggest signs of your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:19: Have you ever considered about the (idols of) Lāt and ‘Uzzā,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:20: and about the other, the third (idol), namely, Manāt,?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:21: Is it that you have males and He (Allah) has females?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:22: If so, it is a bizarre division.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:23: These are nothing but names you and your fathers have invented; Allah has sent down no authority attached to them. They are following nothing but conjecture and what their own souls desire, while guidance from their Lord has surely reached them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:24: Is it that man can get whatever he wishes?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:25: (No,) because to Allah alone belongs the (good of) the Hereafter and the former life (of this world).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:26: How many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession cannot benefit (any one) at all, but after Allah allows (it) for whomsoever He wills and pleases.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:27: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter call the angels by names of females.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:28: They do not have knowledge about it. They follow nothing but conjecture, and conjecture is of no avail in (the matter of) Truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:29: So, turn away from him who turns away from Our advice, and seeks nothing but (pleasure of) the worldly life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:30: That is the limit of their access to knowledge. Indeed only your Lord knows well about the one who has gone astray from his way, and He knows well about the one who has adopted the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:31: To Allah belongs whatever there is in the heavens and whatever there is in the earth, so that He gives punishment to evildoers for what they did, and gives good reward to those who did good
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:32: -those who abstain from the major sins and from shameful acts, except minor involvements. Indeed your Lord is extensive in forgiveness. He knows you more than anyone else (from a time) when He created you from the earth and when you were embryos in the wombs of your mothers. So, do not claim purity (from faults) for your selves. He knows best who is God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:33: Did you see the one who turned away,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:34: and gave a little, and stopped?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:35: Does he have knowledge of the Unseen whereby he sees (what he believes)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:36: Has he not been told of what was (revealed) in the scriptures of Mūsā
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:37: and of Ibrāhīm who fulfilled (his duties)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:38: (It was) that no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of the other,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:39: and that a man shall not deserve but (the reward of) his own effort,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:40: and that his effort will soon be seen,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:41: then he will be recompensed for it in full,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:42: and that to your Lord is the end (of every one),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:43: and that He is the One who makes (one) laugh and makes (him) weep,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:44: and that He is the One who gives death and gives life,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:45: and that He creates the pairs, male and female,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:46: from a sperm-drop when it is poured (into a womb),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:47: and that the second creation is undertaken by Him,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:48: and that He is the One who gives wealth and preserves (it),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:49: and that He is the One who is the Lord of Sirius (the star worshipped by pagans),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:50: and that He has destroyed the earlier ‘Ād,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:52: and (destroyed) the people of NūH even earlier. Surely they were more unjust and more rebellious.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:53: And He destroyed the overturned towns (of the people of LūT) also,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:54: so enveloped they were by that which enveloped.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:55: Then concerning which of your Lord’s bounties would you remain in doubt?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:56: This (Prophet) is a warner from the (genus of the) previous warners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:57: The Imminent (Hour of Judgment) has approached.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:58: There is no one, beside Allah, to remove it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:59: Do you then wonder at this discourse,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:60: and laugh (at it), and not weep,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:61: while you are engaged in vain play?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 53:62: Now, fall down in prostration and worship (Allah).

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 53:1: By the Star when it sets,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 53:2: your companion has neither gone astray, nor has he erred;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 53:3: nor does he speak out of [his own] desire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 53:4: It is but a revelation that is revealed,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 53:5: taught to him by one of awesome power,
